title: GitHub - grantmcdermott/plot2: Lightweight extension of base R's plot function

last_post.content:
We all love ggplot2 (obvs), but base R plot is underrated IMO.

I finally packaged up a script I've had lying around for a while. The `plot2` #rstats 📦 is a lightweight extension to base R plot that automates grouped plotting and legend handling (plus some extras). https://github.com/grantmcdermott/plot2

Iridescence

2023 03 23 day 273 of doing art every day for a year (mostly – I took sick days off).

For more info, including seeing the time lapse, follow this link: https://lmashton.com/iridescence/

title: A Pattern Language for Generative AI: Your Blueprint for Unlocking AI's Potential

last_post.content:
If GPT-4 is better than $25/hr humans, then what does it imply the worth of the instruction manual for GPT-4?! https://intuitionmachine.gumroad.com/l/gpt4
---
RT @johnjnay
LLMs Are Better Than Human Data Annotators

-GPT-3 was helpful but not better than humans (e.g. https://arxiv.org/abs/2108.13487)

-GPT-3.5 is about on par w/ humans (e.g. https://arxiv.org/abs/2303.16854 w/ self-explanations)

-GPT-4 is better than $25/hr humans (e.g. …

Deepmind released a comprehensive overview of transformer architectures and algorithms!

title: GitHub - andrewheiss/quarto-wordcount: Quarto extension for calculating accurate word counts

last_post.content: Counting words in #rstats markdown / #QuartoPub is hard because it's tricky to capture content like tables, captions, and references. @FrederikAust 's {rmdfiltr} works great for Rmd files, so I adapted it as a Quarto extension. Behold {quarto-wordcount}! https://github.com/andrewheiss/quarto-wordcount

Please do follow @timkmak's amazing in-depth reports from Ukraine. I followed him on Twitter while I was there and gained so much from his on-the-ground accounts of the Ukrainian people's courage and struggles.

(Bonus feature: dogs of war. Other bonus feature: the perils of being a pho and sriracha addict in an Eastern European war zone.)

https://mastodon.scot/@timkmak@journa.host/110169741631089512

You know what? I think Oquonie is complete.

For the past two months @rek and I ported a game of ours for its 10th years anniversary since iOS updates broke it beyond repair.

It has been rewritten to target a virtual machine, which should(hopefully) help us keeping it playable. In the next few days I'll release a document that explains how to write an emulator to run the game.

get game: https://hundredrabbits.itch.io/oquonie
get emulator: https://100r.co/site/uxn.html
get source: https://git.sr.ht/~rabbits/oquonie

#finishit

What do you do when your phone breaks?

Our new ‘right to repair’ initiative will make it easier and cheaper for consumers to repair defective goods.

By promoting repairs both within and beyond the legal guarantee, it will:

🔹 reduce waste,
🔹 boost the repair sector and
🔹 make repairs easier and cheaper for consumers.

title: Atari 50 Makes It Obvious Why Atari Never Recovered from Its Collapse

last_post.content:
Reading this on Atari 50: https://www.pastemagazine.com/article/atari-50-shows-why-atari-failed

The quick version is, essentially, that Atari's output went completely to shit so of course they couldn't come back from that.

Now, ignoring that I'm of the opinion Tempest 2000 is *still* one of the best videogames ever made ever ever (because it is) for a second, I kinda don't really agree. I'm not going to argue Trevor McFur is a great game or anything (love having it on Switch now though), just I don't think Atari 50 can sell later Atari.

title: Six Centuries of Type & Printing (letterpress and ebook bundle)

last_post.content: Back in 2020, I published Six Centuries of Type & Printing, a concise book – 64 pages – that actually starts centuries before Gutenberg, with Chinese and Korea printing, and then digs into 1450 to 2020, covering ~600 years of technological advances. Set in hot-metal type (Monotype Bembo) in North Yorkshire, printed in London, and bound in Germany with a foil-stamped cover & slipcase, I still have copies available for shipping worldwide! https://glog.glennf.com/tiny-type-museum-time-capsule-and-more/six-centuries-letterpress (ebook edition available)

title: ChatGPT’s inconsistent moral advice influences users’ judgment - Scientific Reports

last_post.content:
My first thought: We need a paper about what ChatGPT does with the trolley problem like a hole in the head.

My second thought—and don't confuse this for an endorsement of the paper—was much darker: we probably DO need work on this, and on how humans are influenced by it. The latter is the primary of the subject of the paper.

I was going to complain about how I think the authors rather naively talk about an LLM's moral stance as if such a thing could exist, but...

https://www.nature.com/articles/s41598-023-31341-0

title: United States v. American Tel. and Tel. Co., 552 F. Supp. 131 (D.D.C. 1983)

last_post.content:
While we're talking telephones, I recently re-read the 1982 "Modification of Final Judgement" that broke up the Bell System into separate local and long distance companies, changing the landscape of US telecom forever.

Aside from the huge impact of the case itself, the opinion is a fascinating history, especially for the significant role Bell Labs played in shaping Judge Greene's rulings.

Long, but richly repays a careful reading. https://law.justia.com/cases/federal/district-courts/FSupp/552/131/1525975/

title: This mutant Venus flytrap mysteriously lost its ability to “count”

last_post.content:
While the typical Venus flytrap can "count" to five, this mutant one can't—and the reason it lacks this rudimentary math skill could be key to explaining the plant's "memory." https://arstechnica.com/science/2023/01/this-mutant-venus-flytrap-mysteriously-lost-its-ability-to-count-to-5/?utm_brand=ars

"Shipwreck Hauntography asserts that nautical archaeology bears the legacy of Early Modern theological imperialism, most evident through the savior-scholar model that resurrects—physically or virtually—ships from wrecks. Instead of construing shipwrecks as dead, awaiting resurrection from the seafloor, this book presents them as vibrant if not recalcitrant objects"

https://www.aup.nl/en/book/9789463727709/shipwreck-hauntography
